Title.evidence: Purpose: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of new staple-line reinforcement (SLR) in pulmonary resection through a prospective study and to compare the results of this study with historical control data in an exploratory study.

Participants.evidence: The subjects of this study were 48 patients who underwent thoracoscopic lobectomy.

Intervention.evidence: The use of SLR in pulmonary resection was safe and effective.

Objective.evidence: Purpose: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of new staple-line reinforcement (SLR) in pulmonary resection through a prospective study and to compare the results of this study with historical control data in an exploratory study.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was air leakage from the staple line.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The subjects of this study were 48 patients who underwent thoracoscopic lobectomy.

Result_Outcome.evidence: When compared with the historical group, the SLR group had a significantly lower incidence of air leakage from the staple line (6.3% vs. 28.5%, P < 0.001) and significantly shorter indwelling chest drainage time ( P = 0.049) and length of hospital stay ( P < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: Three patients had prolonged air leakage as a postoperative pulmonary complication.
